section.title: Original plan
section.p: The originally planned status for the Divvun project as of beginning 2006 was:

ul.li: contract signed with subcontractor, and cooperation established
new, xml-based lexicon format (not really part of the official plan, but it was on my whish-list before we start the cooperation with external companies)

section.p: Relevant for this overview is also the next milestones:

dl.dd: First testversion of Northern Saami and Lule Saami spellchecker for office programs (MSOffice-ALPHA, OpenOffice.org-ALPHA), first testversion of Northern Saami hyphenator (InDesign-ALPHA). Text collection is done.
The second testversions of all the spellcheckers are ready (aSpell-BETA, MSOffice-BETA, OpenOffice.org-BETA, InDesign-BETA).
The spellchechers are ready, and version 1.0 is released (aSpell-FINAL, MSOffice-FINAL, OpenOffice.org-FINAL, InDesign-FINAL).
The project is terminated, all documentation and project information is finished and delivered to a permanent maintenance organisation. Eventual errors from the 1.0 version are corrected.

section.title: Present status
section.p: The actual situation is slightly different:

ul.li:
DONE:
aSpell-ALPHA
started corpus building (but not as much as planned)

NOT DONE:
subcontractor contract and established cooperation
new, xml-based lexicon format (but we are making progress with our name lexicon)
still delayed by the risten.no work last spring
corpus contracts took considerably longer time to finish than expected
the same is true for the public tender process (which is far from finished)
it was good to have a goal and deadline for our aSpell-ALPHA, it helped us focus and finish in time
